citations.narrative:
The enclosure housing six bison and seven elk has a chain link fence dividing two different sections of the enclosure. The
chain link gate that is normally used to divide the two sections is no longer attached to the fencing and is sitting at an
angle between the opening in the fence. The gate is not secured to a post and the animals within the enclosure have to
either walk under the gate or through a space between the gate and the post to get through the opening. The gate has the
potential to fall and injure an animal or create a hazard for the animals trying to get through the opening.
The enclosure housing two yak has two green metal tube gates lying on the ground near the opening between the two
sections of the enclosure. In addition, there is a piece of hog panel that was lying partially on the ground and then curled
up toward the fencing creating an area where the animals could get between the panel and the fencing and potentially get
injured.
The facility housing the animals should be constructed in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
To be corrected by November 21, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The enclosure housing six bison and seven elk has a chain link fence dividing two different sections of the enclosure. The 
chain link gate that is normally used to divide the two sections is no longer attached to the fencing and is sitting at an 
angle between the opening in the fence. The gate is not secured to a post and the animals within the enclosure have to 
either walk under the gate or through a space between the gate and the post to get through the opening. The gate has the 
potential to fall and injure an animal or create a hazard for the animals trying to get through the opening. 
 
The enclosure housing two yak has two green metal tube gates lying on the ground near the opening between the two 
sections of the enclosure. In addition, there is a piece of hog panel that was lying partially on the ground and then curled 
up toward the fencing creating an area where the animals could get between the panel and the fencing and potentially get 
injured.  
 
The facility housing the animals should be constructed in good repair to protect the animals from injury.  
 
To be corrected by November 21, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
